main event: Several witnesses reported seeing a large, bright orange ball-shaped object in the sky near Fultonville, New York on March 30, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be larger than the moon and initially showed up as a very bright light.
The object then seemed to disappear as if being covered by a cloud, before reappearing and appearing to explode.
Witnesses reported the object from various locations including West Winfield, Whitesboro and New York Mills.
The moon was not visible in the sky at the time the object was seen, as it had already set earlier that evening.
The object was compared in brightness to the moon, but the report states it was larger than the moon.
